definitions.definition: Attestation of a fact or event ; testimony .
examples: She can bear witness , since she was there at the time.

definitions.definition: One who sees or has personal knowledge of something.
examples: As a witness to the event, I can confirm that he really said that.

definitions.definition: Someone called to give evidence in a court .
examples: The witness for the prosecution did not seem very credible.

definitions.definition: One who is called upon to witness an event or action , such as a wedding or the signing of a document .
examples: The bridesmaid and best man at a wedding typically serve as the witnesses .

definitions.definition: Something that serves as evidence; a sign or token .

main_definition: ( uncountable ) Attestation of a fact or event ; testimony .
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) One who sees or has personal knowledge of something.
( countable , law ) Someone called to give evidence in a court .
( countable ) One who is called upon to witness an event or action , such as a wedding or the signing of a document .
( countable ) Something that serves as evidence; a sign or token .
